author: Chloe Ward
description:
Golbat is honestly one of my favorite Pokémon. How could it not be? It’s a bat-inspired Pokémon that exudes vampiric flair and looks downright adorable with its oversized mouth and little teeth.

Naturally, I’m thrilled that Mega has faithfully designed a set in Golbat's honor. Right now, you can score a massive 58% discount on the Mini Motion Golbat set over at Amazon US (or a 10% saving in the UK). It's available for $13.50, down from a chunkier $32.39. Forget Pikachu. Golbat, I choose you!

Continue reading Top Lego rival has a spooktacular Pokémon kit that's 58% off
MORE FROM WARGAMER: Best Pokémon cards, Rare Pokémon cards,
title: Top Lego rival has a spooktacular Pokémon kit that's 58% off

author: Matt Bassil
description:
The Magic: The Gathering card Terra Eternal has risen in price by 622%, a massive increase in only a week. Before the Avatar: The Last Airbender spoilers were revealed on August 12, this card was priced at just 90 cents, but now copies are going for $6.50 each, and the number just keeps climbing.

Continue reading MTG card in short supply suddenly spikes 600% thanks to Avatar previews
MORE FROM WARGAMER: All MTG sets in order, Upcoming MTG release dates, How to play MTG
title: MTG card in short supply suddenly spikes 600% thanks to Avatar previews

author: Mollie Russell
description:
Back in November 2024, Wizards of the Coast announced that it was working on a tabletop RPG that wasn’t Dungeons and Dragons. Instead, Exodus would adapt the upcoming videogame of the same name, announced in 2023 and crafted by Bioware and Baldur’s Gate veteran James Ohlen. Fast-forward to August 2025, and there’s still no sign of the Exodus videogame, but Wizards has quietly released its transmedia TTRPG.

Continue reading Wizards of the Coast quietly released its Exodus RPG, and it's just DnD in space
MORE FROM WARGAMER: DnD 2024 Player's Handbook review, DnD classes guide, DnD races guide
title: Wizards of the Coast quietly released its Exodus RPG, and it's just DnD in space

author: Mollie Russell
description:
Ark Nova is one of the most loved board games in the world right now. Its BoardGameGeek ratings are out of this world, and it’s got a list of accolades as long as an elephant’s trunk. There’s just one problem that keeps Ark Nova away from perfection. The game is ugly as hell, and even a new box of 3D upgrades can’t fix its unfortunate looks.

Continue reading Ark Nova gets new 3D buildings, but the hit board game is still an eyesore
MORE FROM WARGAMER: Best board games , Couples' board games, Board games for adults
title: Ark Nova gets new 3D buildings, but the hit board game is still an eyesore
